arXiv is a free distribution service and an open-access archive for nearly 2.4 million scholarly articles in the fields of physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative biology, quantitative finance, statistics, electrical engineering and systems science, and economics. Materials on this site are not peer-reviewed by arXiv.

The OWASP Cheat Sheet Series was created to provide a concise collection of high value information on specific application security topics. These cheat sheets were created by various application security professionals who have expertise in specific topics.

resourceName: Cloud-Conscious Tactics, Techniques and Procedures Overview
description: This deck by CrowdStrike, hosted on the Cloud Security Forum Slack Workspace outlines Cloud-Conscious TTPs, including threat actors within cloud networks, most common attack tactics, and techniques and some AWS case studies, including an overview of the cyber threat group Scattered Spider. The Cloud Security Forum Slack workspace is an active and vibrant forum for all things cloud security, and where the fwd:cloudsec conferences are organized. There are active communities around AWS, Azure, GCP, threat detection, jobs, and events. Membership is open to anyone, at any level of cloud security expertise.

The Cloud Security Atlas by Datadog Security Labs is a risk register for Threats and Vulnerabilities. This database gives you the ability to search and filter on your cloud provider platform, risk type, and sort by impact, exploitability, and recency. Security Labs is the place for our researchers and engineers to publish practitioner-focused, innovative security content. You will find here a mix of threat research, open-source software, and community-focused posts.

This page contains articles and tools from many different sources relating to CI/CD security. The CloudSecDocs website containing technical notes and knowledge on cloud-native technologies, security, technical leadership, and engineering culture.

Insights from Google Cloud security experts on the frontlines, helping organizations reduce risk and feel confident in their ability to detect and respond to threats. This contains blog posts, datasheets, events, infographics, insights, podcasts, security reports, technical guides, videos, webinars and whitepapers.

resourceName: Security Playbook for Compromised AWS Account Credentials
description: AWS is providing this security incident response playbook that describes the steps needed to detect and respond to compromised credentials within your AWS account(s). The purpose of this document is to provide prescriptive guidance on the actions to take once you suspect a security event has taken place.

This is an educational pivoting handbook for cyber threat intelligence analysts. This website contains simple reference material for how to make the best use of various threat activity observables, such as IP addresses and file hashes. The goal is to map the pivotability of every type of artifact that analysts might encounter in the course of their investigations. For any given observable, analysts can use this handbook to figure out what steps they should take to reveal potentially related malicious infrastructure or tooling. Every listed pivoting method can be performed using one or more tools (depending on preference or which platforms you have access to), and query examples are provided for the most commonly used tools. Mermaid diagrams are also included for easy and clickable navigation between artifact types.

This website is a curated public instance of Wiz Research’s internal cloud threat intelligence database, summarizing information about publicly disclosed cloud security incidents and campaigns. Additionally, the database lists threat actors known to have compromised cloud environments, the tools and techniques in their arsenal, and the technologies they prefer to target. It's current focus is on threat activity known to impact public cloud environments, CI/CD systems and source code management systems, as well as potential threats to servers in general. Incidents are only included if sufficient information is available about them to understand their root cause.
This repo contains public indicators of compromise aggregated by Wiz Research.

The CERT Division is a leader in cybersecurity. They partner with government, industry, law enforcement, and academia to improve the security and resilience of computer systems and networks. They study problems that have widespread cybersecurity implications and develop advanced methods and tools to counter large-scale, sophisticated cyber threats.
